verses.roman:
parighaṁ paṭṭiśaṁ śūlaṁ
carmāsī śakti-tomarau
yad yad āyudham ādatta
tat sarvaṁ so 'cchinad dhariḥ

synonyms: parigham—spiked iron bludgeon; paṭṭiśam—three-pointed spear; śūlam—lance; carma-asī—shield and sword; śakti—pike; tomarau—javelin; yat yat—whatever; āyudham—weapon; ādatta—he took up; tat sarvam—all of them; saḥ—He; acchinat—broke; hariḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa.
translation: Iron bludgeon, three-pointed spear, sword and shield, pike, javelin—whatever weapon Rukmī picked up, Lord Hari smashed it to bits.
